H0.text: To increase blood flow to the limbs for energy production is the most likely response of the body when more energy is used than the calories consumed provide.

H1.text: To release energy from lipids stored throughout the body is the most likely response of the body when more energy is used than the calories consumed provide, as food supplies the calories needed for energy and the body must use energy between meals when food is not consumed.

H2.text: Transforming stored proteins into carbohydrates for energy is the most likely response of the body when more energy is used than the calories consumed provide.

H3.text: To contract muscles to create heat energy for the body is the most likely response of the body when more energy is used than the calories consumed provide, because food supplies the calories needed for energy, yet the body must use energy between meals when food is not consumed.

A4.text: Vertebrates (including humans) use both sources of fat to produce energy for organs such as the heart to function.

A5.text: Triacylglycerols are the major form of energy storage in human body.
